title: (x) Looking for trendy fonts - Danube/various {Mike F/gang}
content:
Can anyone tell me what font is used in these logos?

[http://www.pixellogo.com/thumbnails/L-773.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.pixellogo.com/thumbnails/L-773.gif "http://www.pixellogo.com/thumbnails/L-773.gif")

[http://www.pixellogo.com/thumbnails/L-751.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.pixellogo.com/thumbnails/L-751.gif "http://www.pixellogo.com/thumbnails/L-751.gif")

Also, can you suggest a resource that has "Trendy" fonts like the above?
author: elabdesigns

comments.content:
[Device](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.devicefonts.co.uk/) would be my first port of call for this kind of font.  
Tim

Two sites that have similar styles are [Blue Vinyl](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.bvfonts.com/) and [Buro Destruct](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.typedifferent.com/abc/index.html). I'm not sure if your font is from one of these sites, because I have no time to search at the moment.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks guys. Though your links have interesting fonts neither of them had the font in question.

Anyone else?

I think I previously saw a rather similar font on [Union](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.unionfonts.com/), but their site went offline ( ? ), a few weeks ago.. _( Whatever happened to Union.? )_

Other 'resources' for 'trendy' fonts may be [Identikal](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.identikalshop.com/), [DesignerShock](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.ds4sale.com/), and [T.26](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.t26.com/), of course..  
_( Oh, And, Dont forget 'DIN' and 'Eclat'.. :)_

' [Tierra](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts-tierra.htm)', _by Alejandro Paul / SudTipos, may be a classy alternate_..

( ' [Pico](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www2.wind.ne.jp/maniackers/pico.html)', _by Maniackers Design, may be another close, and free, alternate, as well_.. )

Your sought after font is Levi Halmos [Danube](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209195847/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?q=danube&nb_ppp_old=10&page=1&text=liquidnet+topa&nb_ppp=10&classt=alpha). Unfortunately, his No Images website was pared down to empty folders several months ago, but the documentation is included in the Dafont download.
Of course you could commision someone to make you a custom font... This would be the place to find them.
Mike F - NICE! Thanks. I visit DaFont on regular basis, I dont know how I over looked that font. Much Thanks!
